basics.name: Alex Tsankov
basics.label: Computer Science and Philosophy Student
basics.summary: Blending my love of computers with my passion for the humanities -- all while playing with as many new technologies as possible in the process.

work.summary: Supporting the needs of Google's infrastructure by both helping to identify and resolve problems, and imprving on internal and external utilities and software. My work interfaces directly with a variety of partners to ensure reliability and accessibility of Googleâ€™s infrastructure to end users.
highlights: Handling tickets from 100s of ISPs from all over the world.
Learning internal Google development tools.
Contributing to the Google codebase.

work.summary: Working to create large scale RESTful Go applications to handle mail notifications. Applications are running on Google App Engine with a Datastore DB. Other parts of application involves dynamic HTML templating and RESTful requests to other APIs both internal and external.
highlights: Learning Go.
Writing a RESTful API.
Contributed to an open-sourece Go library.

work.company: Prof. Eric Keller's Next Generation Networks Group
work.summary: Worked with Prof. Keller on the 'yanc' network controller and SDN technology, specifically integration with Bro Intrusion Detection System. I also did research on applying Test Driven Development practices to Bro script development
highlights: Participated in submitting and helping write a research paper for SIGCOMM.
Developing an automated continuous integration system for an IDS.
Learning about Software Defined Networking(SDN).
Completed through CU Boulder Discovery Learning Apprenticeship.

work.summary: Worked on project to integrate a Prolog AI language parser with a custom IDE designed in the Eclipse RCP framework. Focused on GUI design and programming, data visualization, script automation, SWT graphics, and code documentation in an agile start-up environment.
highlights: Learned proper Object-Oriented development techniques for Java.
Eclipse RCP library for custom applications.
Build automation using Bash.

work.summary: Worked to secure campus network and infrastructure. This included managing a variety of *nix servers and work stations, Juniper firewalls, Cisco security appliances, and intrusion detection systems. Specifically the open-source Bro intrusion detection system.
highlights: Learned to help manage security for 50,000+ host network.
Gained experience working with firewalls and managing vulnerabilities remotely.
Acquired proficiency with using Bash.

work.summary: Managed a diverse set of lab tools in an advanced client-server environment. Includes experience with Symantec management suite, Windows server management, Active Directory,  building images/ghosting, cabling, customer support, and lab documentation.
highlights: Helped build and manage a laboratory of 100+ hosts.
Gained experience ensuring proper connections between hosts and a variety of lab devices.
Worked with Windows SA systems to ensure rapid deployment of updates and patches.

volunteer.summary: Founded a group dedicated to helping improve teacher quality through better course-questionnaires. Worked with a team of CU-Boulder students to help launch an application and survey system to do this. Also worked with Michael Skirpan and Prof. Tom Yeh to perform data analysis.
highlights: Helped manage and set goals for a team of 6+ students and researchers.
Worked with school administration to help create and launch a student group.
Gained valuable project management skills in a semi-agile environment.

volunteer.summary: Created an alternate website to store and visualize our school's faculty/course questionnaires. Programmed and designed the site from scratch and worked with the school newspaper to help publicize it.
highlights: Ruby on Rails running a PostgreSQL database.
Created and maintained open-source project with multiple contributors and public API endpoints.
Managed a website with over 10,000 unique users.

volunteer.summary: In support of constituency, worked with staff on case work, interfaced with the community, including non-profits and other state and federal government agencies. Assisted in official event management.
highlights: Event management.
Helped the community through casework on immigration issues.

skills.name: Web Development
keywords: Frontend Frameworks: Bootstrap, Material Design Lite
Backends: Ruby on Rails, Python Tornado, Python Flask
Development Practices: git, Continuous Integration, Unit Testing

awards.title: Undergraduate Ethics Symposium
awards.summary: Submitted essay about the ethics of automated vehicles. Was sponsored by CU to travel to the conference.

awards.title: Hackathon Prize Winner
awards.summary: Built a text-message based Bitcoin purchasing system. Worked with Twilio and Python Flask.
